intro: Jasione gallaecica, commonly known as the Galician jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or upright depending on the habitat. Jasione gallaecica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
